did.abstract: Miscellaneous correspondence of Hilliard, including a letter, 1860, to Harper and Brothers expressing optimism about Alabama's chances of remaining in the Union; a letter, 1868, to Chief Justice Salmon P. Chase referring to hearings on the proposed trial of Jefferson Davis and mentioning the visit of Kate Chase Sprague and William Sprague, former governor of Rhode Island to Augusta, Ga.; and responses to autograph collectors.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Henry W. Hilliard was a U.S. representative from Alabama; Confederate general, and attorney.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence of Hilliard, including a letter, 1860, to Harper and Brothers expressing optimism about Alabama's chances of remaining in the Union; a letter, 1868, to Chief Justice Salmon P.
